snippet: Investigators also seized files from the airline in a widening inquiry into the crash in Colombia of a jet carrying the Brazilian soccer team Chapecoense....
abstract: Bolivian authorities announce detention of Gustavo Vargas, chief executive of airline LaMia, in connection with plane crash in Colombia that killed 71 people, including members of Brazilian soccer team Chapecoense; arrest suggests widening investigation into crash.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CASEY and MONICA MACHICAO

lead_paragraph: Investigators also seized files from the airline in a widening inquiry into the crash in Colombia of a jet carrying the Brazilian soccer team Chapecoense.

headline.main: Bolivia Detains Chief of Airline in Colombia Crash
headline.print_headline: Bolivia Holds Airline Chief After Crash
